column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=DS : What about 1984 ?
#Text=JR : Yeah , there are people really pissed about 1984 .
#Text=I 've gotten a few emails from people saying that they want to go after 1984 , suggesting that I should , but I do n't know , I just did n't --
#Text=DS : All of a sudden you 'll be in an Orwell genre : Orwell criticism --
#Text=JR :
#Text=For some reason , I do n't mind that one as much .
#Text=There are also so many dystopic . . .
#Text=DS : 1984 is used by both liberals and conservatives to attack each -- each in different ways --
#Text=JR : Yeah , 1984 , as far as I know , does n't have that history of being backed by the CIA .
#Text=On the future of the narrative
#Text=DS : As a writer there 's always a desire to be innovative and original , but you ca n't be original anymore in writing .
#Text=It 's very difficult .
#Text=Almost everything has been done .
#Text=I think that I read somewhere that the only genre of art that has n't fully been mined is maybe poetry .
#Text=JR : Yeah , could be . Well --
#Text=DS : How do you handle the challenge with wanting to be --
#Text=JR : Well , there are new art forms that are forming .
#Text=The Internet is going to have much larger --
#Text=DS : What are they ?
#Text=JR : Well , interestingly , the narrative forms .
#Text=Americans are extremely sophisticated in terms of narrative forms .
#Text=We see it in commercials , we see it on TV , we see it in movies .
#Text=But the narrative forms we 're talking about are three acts , five acts , depending on how you want to look at it .
#Text=They 're all based on a Christian model of sin , suffering , redemption ; which is not a large model .
#Text=We 've actually got a sophisticated view of a relatively narrow sort of idea of what narrative is .
#Text=But as the Internet enables larger shows -- as TV , magazines and the Internet join -- you 're going to have much larger narrative structures .
#Text=Sort of like a soap opera , if you could imagine a soap opera that was on the Internet , where you would have a cross-section of narratives and could go in any direction at once .
#Text=The producers could get behind any narrative at once .

#Text=Essentially , then , what you 've got is large epic structures , or Biblical structures , or mythological structures , where you have strains that interconnect -- different storylines that interconnect and are often discrete -- that make up a whole .
#Text=But the whole thing is n't three acts .
#Text=The whole thing is n't five acts .
#Text=It 's an infinitude of three acts or five acts ; it can be as big as you want .
#Text=DS : Can you conceptualize that to an example ?
#Text=JR : Well , the best example I could give would be the Bible , or Greek mythology .
#Text=DS : On an Internet forum .
#Text=JR : I do n't think that the technology is quite there yet .
#Text=It 's close .
